title: U.S. Drone Attacks in Pakistan
name: U.S. Drone Attacks in Pakistan
description: The approximate locations of U.S. drone attacks in Pakistan since 2004. Strikes prior to 2008 are yellow, those in 2008 during the Bush administration are red, and strikes during the Obama administration in 2009-2010 are green. Most strikes are on Pashtun villages in North and South Waziristan in the Federally Administered Tribal Areas along the Afghan border.

properties.name: April 1, 2009
properties.description: 14 killed in Orakzai Agency tribal area. Source: BBC http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/7975871.stm

properties.name: April 19, 2009
properties.description: At least 3 killed and 5 injured in an attack in South Waziristan. Source: BBC http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/8006646.stm

properties.name: April 26, 2007
properties.description: 4 killed in the village of Saidgai in North Waziristan. Source: AP http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2007/04/27/AR2007042701056.html

properties.name: April 29, 2009
properties.description: Strike in Kanni Garam village in South Waziristan kills 6 people. Source: Dawn http://www.dawn.com/wps/wcm/connect/dawn-content-library/dawn/news/pakistan/provinces/11-six-dead-in-suspected-us-drone-attack--07

properties.name: April 4, 2009
properties.description: 13 killed in North Waziristan, 20 miles west of the region's main town of Miranshah. Source: Reuters http://uk.reuters.com/article/idUKTRE53309720090404

properties.name: April 8, 2009
properties.description: 4 killed in attack on a vehicle in Gangi Khel in South Waziristan. Source: Dawn http://www.dawn.com/wps/wcm/connect/dawn-content-library/dawn/news/pakistan/nwfp/two-killed-in-suspected-drone-attack-in-south-waziristan--il

properties.name: August 11, 2009
properties.description: A strike in Ladha village, South Waziristan, kills 10. Source: BBC http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/8194731.stm

properties.name: August 21, 2009
properties.description: A missile strike on the village of Darpa Kheil, North Waziristan, reportedly targeting Sirajuddin Haqqani, kills at least 21 people. Source: BBC http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/8213354.stm

properties.name: August 27, 2009
properties.description: A missile strike on the Tapar Ghai area in the Kanigram district of South Waziristan kills 8 people. One of the dead was reportedly Tohir Yoâ€˜ldosh, leader of the Islamic Movement of Uzbekistan. Source: BBC http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/8224289.stm

properties.name: August 31, 2008
properties.description: Missile strike on Al-Qaeda training camp in Tappi, Miramshah, North Waziristan kills two militants carrying Canadian passports, as well as six others, including two women. Source: Our Bombs http://www.ourbombs.com/striketracker#strike/1260

properties.name: August 5, 2009
properties.description: A strike in the Zangar area of South Waziristan killed 12, including Baitullah Mehsud, his wife, and his wife's parents. The Pakistani Taliban leader's death was confirmed after weeks of uncertainty. Source: Guardian http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2009/aug/07/baitullah-mehsud-dead-taliban-pakistan

properties.name: December 17, 2009 #1
properties.description: 17 killed in 2 separate attacks in North Waziristan in an area controlled by Hafiz Gul Bahadur. In the first attack, two missiles hit a car near Dosali, killing two. Source: Military Times http://militarytimes.com/news/2009/12/ap_pakistan_strike_121709/

properties.name: December 17, 2009 #2
properties.description: In the second attack of the day, 10 missiles fired by five drones hit two compounds in Ambarshaga, killing 15 people. Unnamed sources stated that seven of the dead were "foreigners." Source: Military Times http://militarytimes.com/news/2009/12/ap_pakistan_strike_121709/

properties.name: December 18, 2009
properties.description: 3 killed in an attack in Dattakhel region in North Waziristan. Source: BBC http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/8420701.stm

properties.name: December 22, 2008
properties.description: At least 8 killed in South Waziristan by suspected US drone strike. Source: VOA http://www1.voanews.com/english/news/a-13-2008-12-22-voa11-66619067.html

properties.name: December 26, 2009
properties.description: 13 killed in an attack in Saidgai village in North Waziristan. Source: Xinhua http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2009-12/27/content_12711502.htm

properties.name: December 31, 2009
properties.description: At least 3 killed in an attack in Machikhel village in North Waziristan. According to The Frontier Post, senior Taliban leader and strong Haqqani ally Haji Omar Khan, brother of Arif Khan, was killed in the strike, along with the son of local tribal leader Karim Khan. Source: CNN http://edition.cnn.com/2009/WORLD/asiapcf/12/31/pakistan.drone.strike/

properties.name: December 8, 2009
properties.description: 3 killed in a car near Miranshah in North Waziristan, reportedly including 2 al-Qaeda members. Senior al-Qaeda planner Saleh al-Somali, a Somali citizen, is believed to have died in this strike. Source: BBC http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/8400800.stm

properties.name: December 9, 2009
properties.description: Six killed in Tanga, Ladha, South Waziristan, four of whom are al-Qaeda -- and two Taliban. Source: Long War Journal http://www.longwarjournal.org/archives/2009/12/us_strike_kills_four.php

properties.name: February 14, 2009
properties.description: More than 30 killed when two missiles are launched by drones near town of Makin in South Waziristan. Source: NYTimes http://www.nytimes.com/2009/02/15/world/asia/15pstan.html

properties.name: February 14, 2010
properties.description: A U.S. drone fired two missiles at a compound about 13 miles west of Miranshah, killing six militants. Source: CNN http://edition.cnn.com/2010/WORLD/asiapcf/02/14/pakistan.attacks/

properties.name: February 15, 2010
properties.description: Abdul Haq al-Turkistani, leader of the Turkistani Islamic Party is one of 3 militants killed when a U.S. drone targets a vehicle in the village of Tapi, about 9 miles east of Miranshah. Source: Reuters http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2010/02/15/AR2010021501041.html

properties.name: February 16, 2009
properties.description: Strike in Baggan village in the Kurram Valley kills 30, reportedly at a Taliban training camp for fighters preparing to combat coalition forces in Afghanistan. Source: Guardian http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2009/feb/16/pakistan-us-missile-strike

properties.name: February 17, 2010
properties.description: A drone attack targeting a suspected militant compound killed two people and wounded three others in Tabbi Took Kil, North Waziristan. Top al-Qaeda leader of Egyptian origin Sheikh Mansoor was among the dead. Source: CNN http://edition.cnn.com/2010/WORLD/asiapcf/02/17/pakistan.drone.attack/

properties.name: February 18, 2010
properties.description: A missile strike killed 4 militants in a compound in the Dandey Darpa Khel area about 3 miles from Miranshah. Muhammad Haqqani, son of Jalaluddin Haqqani, was one of the victims. Source: AFP http://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5jkGBDF6-qAwU5sfZxPWf1LkIPgUQ

properties.name: February 2, 2010 #1
properties.description: The first of the day's 3 attacks was when drones fired six missiles at compounds in the Daigaan area of North Waziristan, close to the border with Afghanistan about 15 miles west of Miran Shah. At least four people were killed, likely from the Haqqani network. In total, the day's barrage of 19 missiles from 8 drones killed an estimated 29 people. Source NYTimes http://www.nytimes.com/2010/02/03/world/asia/03pstan.html

properties.name: February 2, 2010 #2
properties.description: The day's second attack took place in Mamad Khel, another part of North Waziristan that is close to Daigaan. Residents in Miran Shah said the targets of these attacks were militants who fired on the drones flying overhead. In total, the day's barrage of 19 missiles from 8 drones killed an estimated 29 people. Source: NYTimes http://www.nytimes.com/2010/02/03/world/asia/03pstan.html

properties.name: February 2, 2010 #3
properties.description: The third drone strike of the day, in the area of Khar Qamar, hit two vehicles on their way to the scene of the day's previous attacks. At least six militants were killed. In total, the day's barrage of 19 missiles from 8 drones killed an estimated 29 people. Source: NYTimes http://www.nytimes.com/2010/02/03/world/asia/03pstan.html

properties.name: February 24, 2010
properties.description: 3 missiles struck a compound used by al-Qaeda-affiliated local and foreign militants in the Darga Mandi area of North Waziristan. Among the nine militants killed included Qari Zafar, carrying a reward of $5 million for his alleged involvement in the 2006 bombing of Karachi's U.S. Consulate. Source: NYTimes http://www.nytimes.com/2010/02/25/world/asia/25pstan.html

properties.name: February 27, 2008
properties.description: 12 people killed in a strike near Kalosha village in South Waziristan. Source: Al Jazeera http://english.aljazeera.net/news/asia/2008/02/200852512642126874.html

properties.name: January 1, 2009
properties.description: 2 senior al-Qaeda leaders, Usama al-Kini and Sheikh Ahmed Salim Swedan, killed in a missile strike. Both men had long been on the FBI's Most Wanted list for their role in the 1998 U.S. Embassy bombings in Kenya and Tanzania. Source: Fox News http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,478204,00.html

properties.name: January 1, 2010
properties.description: A missile strike on a vehicle near Ghundikala village in North Waziristan kills 3. Source: Dawn http://www.dawn.com/wps/wcm/connect/dawn-content-library/dawn/news/pakistan/07-drone-strike-kills-three-militants-in-n-waziristan-ha-04

properties.name: January 13, 2006
properties.description: An airstrike kills 18 in Damadola, Bajaur, but misses Ayman al-Zawahri. Source: Telegraph http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/asia/pakistan/1507895/Pakistan-fury-as-CIA-airstrike-on-village-kills-18.html

properties.name: January 14, 2010
properties.description: Pakistani Taliban leader Hakimullah Mehsud is reportedly killed in an attack that kills 15 militants in Shaktoi, South Waziristan. Also, Abdul Basit Usman, a member of Filipino Islamist group Abu Sayyaf, is killed in the attack. Source: CNN http://edition.cnn.com/2010/WORLD/asiapcf/01/15/pakistan.taliban/

properties.name: January 15, 2010 #1
properties.description: A drone missile attack killed five militants in Zanini, outside Mir Ali in North Waziristan. Source: AFP http://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5jQK0c8NshxJmKSTUaB1D7ZaADgNw

properties.name: January 15, 2010 #2
properties.description: Second missile strike of the day kills 6 in Bichi village in North Waziristan. Source: AFP http://news.yahoo.com/s/afp/20100115/wl_sthasia_afp/pakistanunresttaliban

properties.name: January 17, 2010
properties.description: In the 9th drone attack of 2010, four missiles slammed into a house in the Shaktoi area of South Waziristan. The house targeted was used by Usman Jan, head of the al-Qaeda-linked Islamic Movement of Uzbekistan, Five Uzbeks were killed in the strike, and the rest were Pakistani Taliban. Source: AP http://www.washingtonexaminer.com/world/81908732.html#ixzz0cwdTl1a3

properties.name: January 19, 2010
properties.description: Two missiles fired at a compound in the Booya village of the Datakhel sub-division, 20 miles west of Miranshah in North Waziristan kill at least 6 militants. Source: VOA http://www1.voanews.com/english/news/asia/Drone-Missiles-Kill-5-in-Pakistan-82068337.html

properties.name: January 23, 2009
properties.description: In the first attacks since Barack Obama became US president, at least 14 killed in Waziristan in 2 separate attacks by 5 missiles fired from drones. Missile #2 was aimed at the house of a Taliban commander about 6 miles from Wana, South Waziristan. Source: http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/7847423.stm

properties.name: January 23, 2009
properties.description: In the first attacks since Barack Obama became US president, at least 14 killed in Waziristan in 2 separate attacks by 5 missiles fired from drones. Missile #1 hit a house in a village called Zarakai near the town of Mirali, North Waziristan. Source: http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/7847423.stm

properties.name: January 25, 2010
properties.description: An unmanned aircraft went down about 8 p.m. (10 a.m. EST) near the village of Hamzoni in North Waziristan, about 3 miles west of Miran Shah http://edition.cnn.com/2010/WORLD/asiapcf/01/25/pakistan.crash/

properties.name: January 26, 2010
properties.description: A US drone crashes 2.5 miles from the town of Miranshah, and local tribesmen claim they shot it down -- the 2nd to be hit in as many days. http://www.digitaljournal.com/article/286475

properties.name: January 29, 2008
properties.description: Senior al-Qaeda commander Abu Laith al-Libi, as well as seven Arabs and six Central Asians, died in a missile strike that hit a village near Mir Ali, North Waziristan. Source: BBC http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/7220823.stm

properties.name: January 29, 2010
properties.description: Nine suspected militants were killed in a US drone strike on a militant compound in Muhammad Khel, a town in North Waziristan. http://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5hTS40m0EA1PurEIleQRTDxsnh9Ng

properties.name: January 3, 2010
properties.description: 5 militants including 3 Arabs killed in an attack on Mosakki village around Mir Ali, North Waziristan. Source: Dawn http://www.dawn.com/wps/wcm/connect/dawn-content-library/dawn/news/pakistan/provinces/06-us-drone-attack-kills-two-in-north-waziristan-rs-04

properties.name: January 6, 2010
properties.description: 2 separate missile strikes one hour apart kill approximately 20-25 people in Sanzalai village, North Waziristan. The attacks were the deadliest since a suicide bomber killed 7 CIA officers and injured 6 others at Forward Operating Base Chapman in Afghanistan, used by the CIA to coordinate drone attacks in Pakistan. Source: NYTimes http://www.nytimes.com/2010/01/07/world/asia/07drones.html

properties.name: January 8, 2010
properties.description: A missile strike in Tappi village in North Waziristan kills 5 people. All the militants killed were local and attached to Taliban Commander Hafiz Gul Bahadur. Source: AFP http://news.yahoo.com/s/afp/20100108/wl_sthasia_afp/pakistanunrestnorthwestmissile

properties.name: January 9, 2010
properties.description: Strike kills one of FBI's most wanted terrorists: Jamal Saeed Abdul Rahim, a member of al-Qaeda and Abu Nidal. In total, 4 killed and 3 injured when 2 missiles are fired on a compound in Ismail Khan in North Waziristan, which is territory of the Haqqani network. Source: AP http://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2010/01/15/world/AP-AS-Pakistan.html

properties.name: July 17, 2009
properties.description: A strike on a house in North Waziristan, 19 miles from Miranshah, kills 4 people. Source: BBC http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/8156039.stm

properties.name: July 28, 2008
properties.description: South Waziristan missile strike in Zeralita, Azam Warsak, kills 6 al-Qaeda operatives, including Midhat Mursi, a notorious bomb maker who trained Richard Reid and Zacarias Moussaoui. Originally form Egypt, Mursi ran the Derunta training camp in Afghanistan. Source: Reuters http://www.reuters.com/article/idUSISL22167020080728

properties.name: July 3, 2009
properties.description: US Drone kills 17 people and injures a further 27. Source: Press TV http://www.presstv.ir/detail.aspx?id=99667&sectionid=351020401

properties.name: July 7, 2009
properties.description: A strike on a militant compound in the Zangarha area 9 miles north-east of the town of Ladha in South Waziristan kills at least 12 people. Source: BBC http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/8137640.stm

properties.name: July 8, 2009 #1
properties.description: A strike on a hideout in Karwan Manza area, some six miles south-east of Ladha, kills at least 10 militants. and on a vehicle convoy in South Waziristan kills at least 50 people. Source: BBC http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/8139739.stm

properties.name: July 8, 2009 #2
properties.description: In the second attack of the day, 40 militants died when five missiles hit a vehicle convoy on the main road between Ladha and Sararogha in South Waziristan. Source: BBC http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/8139739.stm

properties.name: June 14, 2009
properties.description: A strike on a vehicle in South Waziristan kills 5 people. Source: Reuters http://www.reuters.com/article/idUSTRE55D07620090614

properties.name: June 18, 2004
properties.description: 5 killed, including Nek Muhammad Wazir, near Wana, South Waziristan. Source Dawn: http://www.dawn.com/2004/06/19/top1.htm

properties.name: June 18, 2009
properties.description: A strike in Shahalam village in South Waziristan kills 5 people. Source: Xinhua http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2009-06/18/content_11561116.htm

properties.name: June 19, 2007
properties.description: 20 killed in the village of Mami Rogha in North Waziristan. Source: Washington Post http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2007/06/19/AR2007061901898.html

properties.name: June 23, 2009 #1
properties.description: A strike in Neej Narai in South Waziristan kills at least 8 people. The remote area, about 65 kilometers north of the main district town of Wana, is under the control of Baitullah Mehsud's Tehreek-i-Taliban Pakistan (TTP). Source: Dawn http://www.dawn.com/wps/wcm/connect/dawn-content-library/dawn/news/pakistan/04-suspected-us-drone-strikes-swaziristan-qs-03

properties.name: June 23, 2009 #2
properties.description: An airstrike in Makin kills over 60 people but misses Baitullah Mehsud. Many of the dead were attending the funerals of people killed in air strikes earlier that day. The strike is likely the deadliest drone attack to date. Source: NYTimes http://www.nytimes.com/2009/06/24/world/asia/24pstan.html

properties.name: March 1, 2009
properties.description: Strike in Sararogha village in South Waziristan kills 7 people. Source: BBC http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/7917604.stm

properties.name: March 10, 2010
properties.description: Two missiles fired by a drone struck a compound and three vehicles in the village of Mizar Madakhel in North Waziristan, killing at least 12 militants. Source: NYTimes http://www.nytimes.com/2010/03/11/world/asia/11drone.html

properties.name: March 12, 2009
properties.description: 24 killed in attack in Berju in Kurram Agency. Source: Dawn http://www.dawn.com/wps/wcm/connect/dawn-content-library/dawn/news/pakistan/nwfp/seven-killed-in-drone-attack-in-lower-kurram-agency--il

properties.name: March 15, 2009
properties.description: 4 killed in Jani Khel in Bannu district in North-West Frontier Province. Source: NYTimes http://www.nytimes.com/2009/03/17/world/asia/17drone.html

properties.name: March 16, 2008
properties.description: 16 killed in a strike in Shahnawaz Kheil Dhoog, South Waziristan. The dead included nine Islamist militants, including one Arab and two Turkmen fighters. Source: ITN http://itn.co.uk/884f1af60c3aa39b93d09ec486ec7885.html

properties.name: March 25, 2009
properties.description: 7 killed in attacks on 2 vehicles by two missiles in Makin area of South Waziristan. Source: BBC http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/7963865.stm

properties.name: March 26, 2009
properties.description: A strike killed 4 militants in the Essokhel area, around 19 miles east of Mir Ali town in the North Waziristan tribal region. Source: Times of India http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/Suspected-US-missile-strike-kills-four-in-Pakistan-Officials/articleshow/4317107.cms?TOI_latestnews

properties.name: March 8, 2010
properties.description: Missiles fired by a US drone aircraft kill 5 suspected militants inside the compound of a veterinary hospital in Miranshah. Source: BBC http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/8556922.stm

properties.name: May 12, 2009
properties.description: A strike in Sra Khawra village in South Waziristan kills 8 people. Source: BBC http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/8045106.stm

properties.name: May 14, 2005
properties.description: Haitham al-Yemeni killed in a strike near the Afghan border in North Waziristan. Source: Washington Post http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2005/05/14/AR2005051401121.html

properties.name: May 14, 2008
properties.description: 12 people, including Abu Sulayman Al-Jazairi, an al-Qaeda leader from Algeria, killed near the hamlet of Khaza, in the Damadola area of Bajaur. The missiles hit the compound of Maulavi Ismail, where militants had gathered for dinner. Source: Dawn http://www.dawn.com/2008/05/15/top5.htm

properties.name: May 16, 2009
properties.description: A strike in the village of Sarkai Naki in North Waziristan kills 25 people. Many of the dead were Pakistani militants belonging to a group led by Hafiz Gul Bahadar. A Pakistani intelligence official identified one of the Arab men killed by the drone airstrike as Asad al-Misri. Source: NYTimes http://www.nytimes.com/2009/05/17/world/asia/17pstan.html

properties.name: May 9, 2009
properties.description: A strike in Sararogha in South Waziristan kills 6 people. Source: Dawn http://www.dawn.com/wps/wcm/connect/dawn-content-library/dawn/news/pakistan/suspected+us+drone+strike+kills+six+-rs

properties.name: November 14, 2008
properties.description: 12 killed in a strike in a village outside Miranshah. A Pakistani security official said that nine foreign militants - believed to be al-Qaeda fighters - were among those killed. Source: The Times http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/asia/article5152912.ece

properties.name: November 18, 2009
properties.description: 4 killed and 5 injured in Shanakhora village of North Waziristan, 12 miles south of Miranshah. Source: AFP http://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5gTRQcdNeByfeRiEv2X5yL-HERq4w

properties.name: November 19, 2008
properties.description: Abdullah Azam al-Saudi, along with five other al-Qaeda militants, killed in Bannu district. US intelligence officials had identified him as the main link between Al-Qaeda's senior command and Taliban networks in the Pakistani border region with Afghanistan. Source: Newsweek http://www.newsweek.com/id/169870

properties.name: November 2, 2007
properties.description: 5 killed in an attack on a madrasa in a village outside Miran Shah, North Waziristan. Source NYTimes: http://www.nytimes.com/2007/11/03/world/asia/03drone.html?_r=1

properties.name: November 20, 2009
properties.description: 8 killed in the Machikhel area near the town of Mir Ali. Source: BBC http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/8369795.stm

properties.name: November 22, 2008
properties.description: British-Pakistani al-Qaeda operative Rashid Rauf and 4 others, including Abu Zubair al-Masri, killed in a strike in Ali Khel, North Waziristan. Source: NYTimes http://www.nytimes.com/2008/11/23/world/asia/23rauf.html?_r=1

properties.name: November 30, 2005
properties.description: Al-Qaeda's #3, Abu Hamza Rabia, killed in an attack in Asoray, near Miranshah, the capital of North Waziristan. Source: Daily Telegraph http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/asia/pakistan/1504718/Al-Qaeda-number-three-killed-by-CIA-spy-plane-in-Pakistan.html

properties.name: November 5, 2009
properties.description: 2 killed in Miranshah, North Waziristan. Source: Turkish Weekly http://www.turkishweekly.net/news/92433/-suspected-us-drone-attack-kills-2-in-pakistan.html

properties.name: October 15, 2009
properties.description: U.S. drone missile kills at least four people in Darpa Khel in North Waziristan. Source: BBC http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/8308157.stm

properties.name: October 16, 2008
properties.description: Senior Al-Qaeda leader Khalid Habib, an Egyptian citizen, is killed in a strike near Taparghai, South Waziristan, along with five other al-Qaeda or Taliban members. Long War Journal http://www.longwarjournal.org/archives/2008/10/us_strikes_kills_al.php

properties.name: October 21, 2009
properties.description: A U.S. drone missile killed two or three alleged militants in Spalaga, North Waziristan, in territory controlled by Hafiz Gul Bahadur. One of those killed was reportedly Abu Ayyub al-Masri (not the same as Abu Ayyub al-Masri, the al-Qaeda in Iraq leader), an explosives expert for al-Qaeda and a "Tier 1" target of US counter-terrorism operations. Source: The Australian http://www.theaustralian.com.au/news/world/us-drone-takes-out-al-qaida-kingpin/story-e6frg6so-1225790245210

properties.name: October 22, 2008
properties.description: 4 killed in a village near Miranshah by missiles fired from suspected US drone. Source: Reuters http://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9A01E5DA133BF930A15753C1A96E9C8B63&sec=&spon=

properties.name: October 24, 2009
properties.description: A U.S. drone strike kills 27 in Damadolla, inside Bajaur tribal agency. The 27 victims were reportedly a mix of Taliban and al-Qaeda operatives in a strategy meeting. The dead include 11 "foreigners." One of those reported killed is Faqir Mohammed's nephew, Zahid, and another is Mohammed's unnamed son-in-law. The meeting was apparently being held to decide on whether to reinforce South Wazaristan against Pakistani forces. Source: The Nation http://www.nation.com.pk/pakistan-news-newspaper-daily-english-online/Regional/Islamabad/24-Oct-2009/Death-toll-rises-to-27-in-Bajaur-drone-attack

properties.name: October 26, 2008
properties.description: 20 killed in a strike in Mandatta, South Waziristan. Top Taliban commander Mohammad Omar is among the dead. Source: BBC http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/7692373.stm

properties.name: October 31, 2008 #1
properties.description: 20 killed, including Al-Qaeda operative Abu Akash and Mohammad Hasan Khalil al-Hakim (alias Abu Jihad al-Masri), after 2 missiles hit near Mir Ali, North Waziristan. Source: The Times of London http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/asia/article5059109.ece

properties.name: October 31, 2008 #2
properties.description: In the second targeted assassination of the day, two missiles hit a house near Wana, the main town of South Waziristan. The building was a terrorist hideout, and up to 12 rebels died. Source: The Times http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/asia/article5059109.ece

properties.name: September 12, 2008
properties.description: 12 killed in Miranshah airstrike on two separate buildings. Seven Taliban are among the dead. Source: BBC http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/7611721.stm

properties.name: September 14, 2009
properties.description: Drone-fired missile kills four people in a car 1.5 miles from Mir Ali in North Waziristan. Source: Military Times http://militarytimes.com/news/2009/09/ap_pakistan_missile_attack_091409/

properties.name: September 23, 2008
properties.description: Pakistani officials say a drone went down on the Pakistan side of the border with Afghanistan, near Jalal village in the Angoor Adda region of South Waziristanhttp. ://www.wired.com/dangerroom/2008/09/this-much-we--1/

properties.name: September 24, 2009
properties.description: Drone-fired missile kills up to 12 people in the village of Dande Darpa Khel near Mir Ali. Source: Military Times http://militarytimes.com/news/2009/09/ap_pakistan_strike_092509/

properties.name: September 29, 2009 #1
properties.description: In the first strike of the day, a drone attack reportedly kills six Taliban, including two Uzbek fighters and Taliban commander Irfan Mehsud, in a compound in Sararogha village, South Waziristan. Source: Daily Times http://www.dailytimes.com.pk/default.asp?page=2009\09\30\story_30-9-2009_pg1_1

properties.name: September 29, 2009 #2
properties.description: In the second strike of the day, a missile killed seven insurgents in a house in Dande Darpa Khel village, North Waziristan. Source: Daily Times http://www.dailytimes.com.pk/default.asp?page=2009\09\30\story_30-9-2009_pg1_1

properties.name: September 30, 2008
properties.description: 6 killed in a strike near Mir Ali, North Waziristan. Source: Telegraph http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/asia/pakistan/3114374/Pakistan-US-drone-strike-kills-six-people.html

properties.name: September 8, 2008
properties.description: 23 killed in Daande Darpkhel airstrike in Daande Darpkhel near Miranshah, North Waziristan. The targets of the airstrike were Jalaluddin Haqqani and his son Sirajuddin. Haqqani escaped, but 8 of his grandchildren were among the dead. Source: NYTimes http://www.nytimes.com/2008/10/24/world/asia/24pstan.html

properties.name: September 8, 2009
properties.description: Drone-fired missiles kill 10 in Dargamandi, North Waziristan. The attack may have killed al-Qaeda leaders Ilyas Kashmiri and Mustafa al Jaziri, as well as three Punjabi militants and two or three local Taliban fighters. Source: Al Jazeera http://english.aljazeera.net/news/asia/2009/09/20099815473888170.html
